timeline.message: Revert changes in tests by keeping API backward compatible.

timeline.bodyText:
I have to double check entire logic of this function, after quick look at the logic that was before looks suspicious.
It looks like we remove only from the nextCache if it present and never from current instance 🤔
timeline.author: sav007

replies.bodyText: Do you mean the current change is suspicious or the old behavior is? This code is quite well tested.
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText:
From what I understand, return result || ... was doing the same. If the result is true, the rest will never be executed.
On a second look, I don't think the tests cover having a nextCache scenario
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText:
I did another iteration to keep it much closer to the original implementation. Behavior wise, it should be the same but I think this will make it easier to review. Let me know if you see any issues.
I am personally not 100% sure how should the implementation be with the nextCache involved.
replies.author: tasomaniac

replies.bodyText:
No sorry for the confusion, I had to mention that it's not about your changes, I meant the logic that we had before.
The issue is that we are removing the next chained cache (nextCache()) and if it  succeed we skip the current one as return result || deleteRecord won't call deleteRecord.
The reason that it's not an issue is because usually SqlNormalizedCache is the last one in the chain but implementation is definitely not correct.
I will fix it in separate PR, let's keep it for now as is.
replies.author: sav007

timeline.message: 2nd iteration on remove function to keep it closer to the original implementation
